prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Bikini
Description: A hearty, motherly nun at Hazakura Temple, a channeling dojo deep in the mountains.
Character 5
Name: Elise Deauxnim
Description: Kind-eyed author and illustrator of picture books. Pearls is huge fan of hers.
Character 6
Name: Iris
Description: A nun at Hazakura Temple. She reminds me so much of "her"...
Character 7
Name: Laurice Deauxnim* (when playing as Wright) → Larry Butz* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Description: Better known as Larry Butz. Current in training as Elise Deauxnim's pupil.
Character 8
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My friend since grade school. Fell from Dusky Bridge and is currently hospitalized.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 10
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor, Manfred von Karma's, daughter. Born/raised in Germany. Prosecutor at 13.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: An old friend. Said to be #1 at the D.A.'s office. Studies foreign judicial systems now.
Character 12
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Older sister of Misty Fey and mother of Pearl and Iris. Is in solitary confinement.
Character 13
Name: ?????? → Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Morgan Fey's daughter and Iris's twin sister. Her father deals in jewelry apparently.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. He wasn't serious when he gave this to me... was he?* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 1
Name: Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. Something about reading people's hearts... What utter nonsense.* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 2
Name: Oh! Cult! New Year's Issue
Description: An occult magazine featuring Hazakura Temple. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Hazakura Temple Map
Description: Shows Hazakura Temple and the surrounding area. Click here for details.
Evidence 4
Name: Hanging Scroll
Description: Shows Misty Fey, Master of the Kurain Technique. Click here for details. Misty Fey's image is obscured by gravy. Click here for details.
Evidence 5
Name: Photo of Elise
Description: Taken by her only pupil, Laurice Deauxnim. She is wearing a white robe and a hood. She was holding a book and a staff. The staff has a crystal sphere attached to it.
Evidence 6
Name: Iris's Hood
Description: A hood that Iris wears at all times. A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.
Iris:
If it's alright with you... I would like you to have this.

Phoenix:
But this is your hood...
Evidence 7
Name: Weather Data
Description: A regional weather report for the night of the crime.
Eagle Mountain Weather Data for Feb. 07
Snow, with occasional lightning strikes.

Snow: 7 to approx. 10:50 PM
Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

Lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45.
Around 30 minutes passed between
the fire starting and going out.
Evidence 8
Name: Note to Iris
Description: Found in the Main Hall. Maybe she dropped it? Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Staff
Description: Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. There is no crystal sphere attached. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim.
Evidence 10
Name: Shichishito
Description: The apparent murder weapon. A seven-branched, jagged sword. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.
Evidence 11
Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.
Evidence 12
Name: Iris's Testimony
Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.
Evidence 13
Name: Crime Photo
Description: The courtyard where Elise Deauxnim was murdered. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: Tracks Photo
Description: Taken that night. [caption] One track is shown leading from Main Gate to Dusky Bridge.
Evidence 15
Name: Larry's Sketch
Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. Click here for details.
Evidence 16
Name: Crystal Sphere
Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.
Evidence 17
Name: Kurain Master's Talisman
Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.
Evidence 18
Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Dagger
Description: Found behind a tree in the Inner Temple garden. The blood is being analyzed now. Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.
Evidence 20
Name: Stone Lantern
Description: A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime.
Evidence 21
Name: Dusky Bridge Photo
Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That night I was helping an acolyte with her training in the Inner Temple. But...
Person: Bikini
Testimony 1
Testimony: Well, as you can see, my back likes to act up. Violently.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 2
Testimony: So, I left Iris to help the acolyte, and returned to Hazakura Temple.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 3
Testimony: Iris came to the Inner Temple. She was dressed exactly as she had been at dinner.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 4
Testimony: There's no bath at the Inner Temple, you see, and I needed a long, hot soak.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was after I had finished, just as I was heading back... that's when I saw it!
Person: Bikini

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 6 (Iris's Hood) states that Iris was wearing the hood before the lights-out bell the night of the crime, and that it protects from evil spirits. However, Testimony 3 by Bikini states that Iris came to the Inner Temple dressed exactly as she had been at dinner. If Iris was wearing the protective hood at the time she came to the Inner Temple, this would contradict Testimony 3, which implies she was not wearing the hood (as it is likely she did not wear it at dinner).

Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 6 and Testimony 3.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
The contradiction lies between Evidence 6 (Iris's Hood) and Testimony 3 (Bikini's statement that Iris didn't have her hood on).

Evidence 6 states that Iris was wearing a magical hood at all times as protection from evil spirits, and she received it before the light's out bell on the night of the crime. This implies Iris was wearing the hood during the crucial time leading up to the crime.

However, Testimony 3 states that Iris did not have her hood on when observed by Bikini.

This is contradictory as they cannot both be true if Iris is supposed to wear the hood at all times and had it on during the night of the crime, but a witness claims she wasn't wearing it.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: When I looked across at the scene, the sword was already in place.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 1
Testimony: Thinking about it now, I didn't actually see her stab Mystic Elise.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 2
Testimony: I saw the instant in which the blade, plunged in to the hilt, was smoothly drawn out.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 3
Testimony: I've never seen so much blood before...
Person: Bikini
Testimony 4
Testimony: That's when I fainted. You can't blame me, can you?
Person: Bikini
Testimony 5
Testimony: And when I awoke... Mystic Ami was... stabbing Mystic Elise through the back!
Person: Bikini

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
The contradiction lies between Testimony 1 and Testimony 5, both from Bikini. In Testimony 1, Bikini states she didn't actually see Mystic Elise being stabbed. However, in Testimony 5, Bikini claims she saw Mystic Ami stabbing Mystic Elise through the back. These two testimonies directly contradict each other about what Bikini witnessed.

Regarding evidence, the weapon "Shichishito" (Evidence 10) had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints but is not the murder weapon, while the actual murder weapon is the victim's staff (Evidence 9), which has a hidden sword.

However, focusing strictly on one contradiction pair between evidence and testimony, the best match is between the Crime Photo (Evidence 13) or other physical evidences and Bikini's testimony of seeing the stabbing, but none directly contradict with the photo evidence straightforwardly.

Since the user asked for only one pair of contradicting evidence and testimony, the most clear contradiction that involves testimony is between Bikini's contradictory statements:

Testimony 1: "I didn't actually see her stab Mystic Elise."  

Testimony 5: "Mystic Ami was... stabbing Mystic Elise through the back!"

But this is two testimonies contradicting, not testimony vs evidence.

Another angle is the "Note to Iris" (Evidence 8) found in the Main Hall, possibly drops by Iris. Iris's Testimony (12) states she rang the lights out bell at 10 PM and was in her room until the murder was discovered. The presence of the note in the Main Hall may contradict her alibi that she was in her room at the time.

Given the above, the best contradiction pairing between evidence and testimony is:

Evidence 8 (Note to Iris) indicating Iris may have been in the Main Hall during the time of the crime, contradicting Iris's Testimony 12 that she was in her room all the time after ringing the lights-out bell at 10 PM.

Testimony 3
Testimony: It takes 15 minutes to walk to Dusky Bridge, but less than 5 using one of those!
Person: Bikini
Testimony 4
Testimony: Maybe they threw the weapon into Eagle River and came back while I was knocked out?
Person: Bikini
Testimony 5
Testimony: ...Iris could have done that. She can drive a snowmobile after all...
Person: Bikini

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 7 (Weather Data) states that lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45 PM and snow was falling from 7 PM to 10:50 PM, with lightning occurring from 10 PM to approx. 11 PM. The evidence also mentions that around 30 minutes passed between the fire starting and going out.

Testimony 0 from Bikini says: "I saw the murder at around 11 PM..." This statement contradicts the timeline established by the autopsy report (Evidence 11) which places the time of death between 10 - 11 PM, and the Weather Data (Evidence 7) that indicates bad weather including lightning and snow around that time. Given the conditions and timelines, seeing the murder at around 11 PM seems less likely or contradicted by the weather events and autopsy timing.

However, the instruction is to pick one pair strictly between evidence and testimony that contradict each other.

Another clearer contradiction is between:

Evidence 6 (Iris's Hood): A protective magical hood that Iris wears at all times, which protects from evil spirits, received before the lights-out bell the night of the crime.

Testimony 12 (Iris's Testimony): Iris rang the lights-out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.

If Iris was in her room protected by the hood, her presence in the crime scene area as implied by some testimonies or potential involvement is contradicted by her testimony that she remained in her room protected by the hood.

But this is not one direct pair given in the question, so another pair:

Evidence 19 (Dagger): Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.

Testimony 4 (Bikini): "Maybe they threw the weapon into Eagle River and came back while I was knocked out?"

Here Bikini is suggesting that the weapon was thrown into the river and someone returned after, but the dagger found in the garden with blood that does not match the victim suggests the dagger was not the murder weapon, and the weapon supposed to have been discarded in the river was not the dagger.

Therefore this pair contradicts regarding the disposal and identification of the weapon.

Therefore, I choose:

Evidence 19 (Dagger): Blood on dagger doesn't match victim.

Testimony 4 (Bikini): Suggests the murder weapon was thrown into river and returned.

This is a contradiction, because testimony implies a disposal of the murder weapon (which would have blood matching victim), but the dagger found with non-matching blood is proposed as the discarded weapon, inconsistent with what Bikini says.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 7 (Weather Data) states that lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45 PM and that snow was falling until approximately 10:50 PM. According to Testimony 2 by Butz, he looked out the window and saw Dusky Bridge on fire, which suggests that the fire started right after the lightning strike. However, Testimony 0 by Butz states that he went to the shack around 9 PM, and it would have been about 10:30 PM when something happened (presumably the fire or related event). This conflicts with the timing in the evidence that places the lightning strike—and presumably the fire—at 10:45 PM or later, not 10:30 PM.

Therefore, the contradiction is between Butz's testimony of the timing of the fire event (~10:30 PM) and the weather data's established time of the lightning strike and fire (10:45 PM+).

cot:
Evidence 7 states that the snow fell from 7 to approximately 10:50 PM and lightning strikes occurred from 10 to approximately 11 PM, with lightning striking Dusky Bridge at 10:45. This means there was significant snow until 10:50 PM. 

Testimony 2 from Butz claims he saw Iris flying and her white hood fluttering. If the snow was falling heavily until 10:50 PM as per evidence 7, it's unlikely for someone to be "flying" or her hood "fluttering" prominently in such weather, especially if it was snowing heavily and cold. This could indicate a contradiction between the conditions described in the evidence and Butz's testimony.
